Detailed Description

This class manages the input devices.

Member Function Documentation

void InputDevices::consumeInput (  )  [static]

This method flags the class so it consumes all events created up to this moment without processing.

bool InputDevices::handleWindowsMessage ( HWND  hWnd,
UINT  msg,
WPARAM &  wParam,
LPARAM &  lParam,
LRESULT &  result 
) [static]

This method processes an incoming Windows message.

Doesn't call DefWindowProc if the message isn't handled. If it returns true, the return code is stored in 'result'.

Parameters:
msg The windows message type.
wParam The message WPARAM.
lParam The message LPARAM.
[out] result The return code
Returns:
Returns true if the message was processed, false otherwise.

void *  hWnd 
)

This method initialises the input devices.

Parameters:
hInst The Windows HINSTANCE.
hWnd The Windows HWND
Returns:
True if the initialisation succeeded, false otherwise.

bool InputDevices::isAltDown (  )  [static]

This helper method returns whether or not either Alt key is down.

Returns:
Returns true if either Alt key is down and false otherwise.

bool InputDevices::isCtrlDown (  )  [static]

This helper method returns whether or not either Ctrl key is down.

bool InputDevices::isKeyDown ( KeyCode::Key  key  )  [static]

This method returns whether or not the input key is down.

Parameters:
key The key to test the state of.
Returns:
Returns true if the key is down and false otherwise.

static Joystick& InputDevices::joystick (  )  [inline, static]

This method returns an object representing the joystick.

int32 InputDevices::keyRepeatCount ( KeyCode::Key  key  )  [static]

Determines the auto-repeat count for the given key.

Parameters:
key The key to test the state of.
Returns:
Returns 0..n if the is down (0 indicating just pressed). Returns -1 if the key is not pressed.

static KeyStates& InputDevices::keyStates (  )  [inline, static]

uint32 InputDevices::modifiers (  )  [static]

This method returns the current state of the modifier keys.

bool InputDevices::processEvents ( InputHandler &  handler  )  [static]

This method processes the pending events in the input devices and sends them to the InputHandler argument.

That is, it calls the handleKeyEvent and handleMouseEvent methods of the interface.

Parameters:
handler The input handler that will process the events.
Returns:
Returns false if an error occurred.

void InputDevices::pushIMECharEvent ( wchar_t *  chs  )  [static]

Insert an IME character event into the event queue.

This gets posted off to the input handler as a KeyEvent with the key code set to KEY_IME_CHAR.

void InputDevices::setFocus ( bool  state,
InputHandler *  handler 
) [static]

This method sets whether or not the application currently has focus.
